document.masterDocTitle: The tribe Anthocorini in Japan (Hemiptera: Anthocoridae): descriptions of new species, review of distribution and bionomics

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: The tribe Anthocorini in Japan (Hemiptera: Anthocoridae): descriptions of new species, review of distribution and bionomics

mods:name.mods:affiliation: Tokushima Prefectural Museum, Bunka-no-Mori Park, Mukôterayama, Hachiman-chô, Tokushima 770 - 8070, Japan;
Research Associate, Division of Invertebrate Zoology, American Museum of Natural History, New York, c / o Nameshi

heading.emphasis:
Key to Japanese species of
Anthocoris

paragraph.keyLead:
2. Anterior half of hemelytra densely covered with recumbent whitish silver setae ( Fig. 7A ); antennal segment III mostly pale brown ( Fig. 7A ). ....................... ...................................................
A. chibi Hiura, 1959

4. Pronotum uniformly blackish brown ( Fig. 7C ); a strip along the inner embolioum dull or pruinose, the outer portion of the embolium shiny; tibiae mostly pale brown ( Figs 7C–D ); paramere subapically with a sharply defined projection ( Figs 10D , 13E–F ). .......... ...........................................
A. confusus Reuter, 1884

caption.paragraph:
Fig. 7. Habitus of
Anthocoris spp.
, dorsal (A, C, E, G, I, K) and lateral (B, D, F, H, J, L) views. A–B –
A. chibi Hiura, 1959
, male; C–D –
A. confusus Reuter, 1884
, male; E–F –
A. japonicus Poppius, 1909
, male; G–H –
A. kalopanacis Kerzhner, 1977
, female; I–J –
A. nemoralis ( Fabricius, 1794 )
, male; K–L –
A. takahashii Hiura, 1959
, male. Scale bars: 1.0 mm.

Fig. 8. Habitus of
Anthocoris spp.
, male, dorsal (A, C–E, G–H) and lateral (B, F) views. A–B –
A. miyamotoi Hiura, 1959
, holotype (Nakanoshima Is., Tokara Isls.); C – same (Wakayama, Honshu); D – same (Kagoshima, Kyushu); E–F –
A. venustus
sp. nov. , holotype (Hokkaido); G – same, paratype (Tochigi, Honshu); H – same, paratype (Nara, Honshu). Scale bars: 1.0 mm.

paragraph.keyLead:
5. Membrane with broad whitish band on basal part ( Fig. 7E ); body 3.3–4.0 mm in length. ................................ .......................................
A. japonicus Poppius, 1909

6. Membrane with two small, indistinct grayish pale markings ( Fig. 7G ); labium reaching to middle of prosternum (not reaching procoxae) ( Fig. 7H ). ............... ..................................
A. kalopanacis Kerzhner, 1977

– Membrane with three large, irregular-shaped whitish markings ( Fig. 7K ); labium just reaching procoxae ( Fig. 7L ). ..........................
A. takahashii Hiura, 1959

7. Head and callus of pronotum usually orangish brown to reddish brown ( Figs 8A–B ); paramere sickle-shaped, rather widened ( Figs 14A–C ); copulatory tube approximately 0.25 mm in length, very thick and wrinkled at basal 2/3 ( Fig. 15F ). ............................... ..........................................
A. miyamotoi Hiura, 1959

– Head and pronotum uniformly blackish ( Figs 8E–H ); paramere slender, very slightly curved ( Figs 14D–F ); copulatory tube approximately 0.8 mm in length, basally thickened with a few twists ( Fig. 15G ). ............. ...................................................
A. venustus
sp. nov.
